artist: Russel Wright; Chase Brass and Copper Company, Waterbury, Connecticut, founded 1837
description: round tray; chrome edges and blue glass base
text: Wright's work for Chase included cocktail wares and coordinated serving pieces like this corn set, with butter pitcher, salt, and pepper, all in the attractive spherical forms Wright employed in his spun aluminum line.  Chase was not in the practice of using the designer's name in advertising, and their production bears the Chase mark only, making these an exception in Wright's work.
title: Tray from Corn Set
